circumstances: 45 minutes after takeoff from Greenville Airport, while conducting local practice, both engines failed simultaneously. The aircraft lost height and crashed in an uninhabited area. The passenger was killed and the pilot was seriously injured. The pilot recently purchased the aircraft and was not familiar with.
probable_cause:
Both engines stopped in flight due to fuel starvation. The following factors were reported: 
- Lack of familiarity with aircraft,
- Mismanagement of fuel,
- Inattentive to fuel supply, 
- Fuel starvation, 
- Failure of both engines, 
- The aircraft was not refueled since purchase,
- Both engines operated from the right main tank.
